class.name: LibSM64
class.brief_description: Singleton that exposes all of [code]libsm64[/code]'s functionality.
class.description: The [LibSM64] singleton exposes all of [code]libsm64[/code]'s constants and public functions. All of the inputs and outputs of the functions are internally converted back and forth between Godot's and [code]libsm64[/code]'s types, acconting for the differences in the coordinate systems, using [member scale_factor] to convert between Godot's metric system and [code]libsm64[/code]'s internal units, and converting time between Godot's seconds and [code]libsm64[/code]'s frames (assuming [code]libsm64[/code] is ticked at a frame rate of 30 frames per second, see [member tick_delta_time]). The functions and constants exposed in this class are meant to be as one-to-one as possible with [code]libsm64[/code]'s C API.

method.name: audio_init
method.description: Initialize [code]libsm64[/code]'s audio system with the given loaded ROM. [b]Warning:[/b] Calling this function with the wrong ROM will cause the game to crash! The expected ROM is the US version of Super Mario 64. The expected SHA-256 hash of the ROM is [code]17ce077343c6133f8c9f2d6d6d9a4ab62c8cd2aa57c40aea1f490b4c8bb21d91[/code].

method.name: audio_tick
method.description: Returns a [PackedVector2Array] of the audio frames generated by [code]libsm64[/code] in the last frame. [b]Note:[/b] This function should be called at the fixed rate of 30 times per second. See [member tick_delta_time].

method.name: global_init
method.description: Initialize [code]libsm64[/code] with the given loaded ROM. Returns the Mario's [Image] resource extracted from the ROM file. [b]Warning:[/b] Calling this function with the wrong ROM will cause the game to crash! The expected ROM is the US version of Super Mario 64. The expected SHA-256 hash of the ROM is [code]17ce077343c6133f8c9f2d6d6d9a4ab62c8cd2aa57c40aea1f490b4c8bb21d91[/code].

method.name: mario_create
method.description: Creates a Mario inside the [code]libsm64[/code] world in [param position]. Returns the created Mario's ID or [code]-1[/code] if the Mario could not be created. [b]Note:[/b] [method static_surfaces_load] must be called before calling this function. [param position] must be directly above the loaded static surfaces.

method.name: mario_tick
method.description: Advances the Mario state by one frame. Returns an array where the first element is the new [LibSM64MarioState] and the second element is the triangle data array for rendering Mario with [ArrayMesh] (see [method ArrayMesh.add_surface_from_arrays]). [b]Note:[/b] This method should be called at the fixed rate of 30 times per second. See [member tick_delta_time].

method.name: register_debug_print_function
method.description: Registers the internal debug print function for [code]libsm64[/code]. The provided [param callback] should be a function that takes one parameter of type [String]. Providing a null [Callable] will unregister the debug print function.

method.name: register_play_sound_function
method.description: Registers the callback function for when [code]libsm64[/code] plays a sound. The provided [param callback] should be a function that takes two parameters, the first of type [enum SoundBits] and the second of type [Vector3]. Providing a null [Callable] will unregister the callback function.

method.name: set_sound_volume
method.description: Set the internal volume of the sounds played by [code]libsm64[/code].

method.name: static_surfaces_load
method.description: Loads the static [param surfaces] into the [code]libsm64[/code] world. This function should be called before any calls to [method mario_create]. [b]Note:[/b] calling this function multiple times will overwrite the previous calls. [b]Note:[/b] These surfaces will delimit the bounderies of the [code]libsm64[/code] world in the XZ plane. This means that Mario can only be above theses surfaces and will hit "invisible walls" at the edges of the world.

method.name: surface_object_create
method.description: Creates a surface object with the provided [param surfaces] at [param postion] with [param rotation] in the [code]libsm64[/code] world. Returns the internal object ID of the created surface object.

method.name: surface_object_delete
method.description: Deletes the surface object identified by [param object_id] in the [code]libsm64[/code] world.

method.name: surface_object_move
method.description: Moves the surface object identified by [param object_id] in the [code]libsm64[/code] world to a new [param position] with a [param rotation]. [b]Note:[/b] If moving an object continuously over time (like a moving platform), this method should be called at the fixed rate of 30 times per second. See [member tick_delta_time].

members.member: The scale factor used to convert Godot values into [code]libsm64[/code] values (and vice-versa). When passing Godot's metric values to [LibSM64] methods, they will be multiplied internaly by [member scale_factor]. When [LibSM64] methods return SM64's unit values, they will be divided by [member scale_factor]. The bigger the scale, the smaller Mario will be in the Godot scene. In SM64 units, Mario's hitbox is 161 units tall and 100 units wide. Therefore, at 100.0 scale, Mario's hitbox will be 1.61 meters tall and 1.0 meter wide in the Godot scene. This property can be configured in the [code]"libsm64/scale_factor"[/code] project setting (but can only be changed at runtime directly). [b]Warning:[/b] This value should only be changed before [method global_init] is called (or between [method global_terminate] and [method global_init] calls), otherwise strange things will happen.

The delta time that [code]libsm64[/code] expects to be ticked at in seconds (fixed at 1/30th of a second). All time values used as inputs and outputs are converted between Godot's seconds and [code]libsm64[/code]'s fixed frametime using this value.

constants.constant: Lava/Frostbite (in SL), but is used mostly for Lava.
Unused, has no function and has parameters.
Ceiling that Mario can climb on.
Water, has no action, used on some waterboxes below.
Intangible (Separates BBH mansion from merry-go-round, for room usage).
Very slippery, mostly used for slides.
TTM vines, has no action defined.
Plays the Merry go round music, see [code]handle_merry_go_round_music[/code] in [code]bbh_merry_go_round.inc.c[/code] in the Super Mario 64 decompilation project for more details.
Instant warp to another area, used to warp between areas in WDW and the endless stairs to warp back.
Instant warp to another area, used to warp between areas in WDW.
Instant warp to another area, used to warp between areas in DDD, SSL and TTM.
Instant warp to another area, used to warp between areas in DDD, SSL and TTM.
Used for some walls, Cannon to adjust the camera, and some objects like Warp Pipe.
Slippery Ice, in snow levels and THI's water floor.
Look up and warp (Wing cap entrance).
Hard and slippery (Always has fall damage).
Hard and very slippery (Always has fall damage).
Hard and Non-slippery (Always has fall damage).
Death at bottom with vertical wind.
Wide camera for BOB and WF bosses.
Free roam camera for THI and TTC.
Surface where there's a wall kick section in THI 3rd area, has no action defined.
Surface that enables far camera for platforms, used in THI.
Surface camera that returns to the middle, used on the 4 pillars of SSL.
Surface camera that rotates to the right (Bowser 1 & THI).
Surface camera that rotates to the left (BOB & TTM).
Intangible Area, only used to restrict camera movement.
Very slippery floor with noise, unused.
Very slippery floor with noise, unused.
Very slippery floor with noise, used in CCM.
Surface with no cam collision flag.
Surface with no cam collision flag, unused.
Surface with no cam collision flag, very slippery with noise (THI).
Surface with no cam collision flag, slippery with noise (CCM, PSS and TTM slides).
Surface with no cam collision flag, non-slippery with noise, used by switches and Dorrie.
Vanish cap walls, pass through them with Vanish Cap.
Painting wobble (DDD - Left), makes the painting wobble if touched.
Painting wobble (HMC & COTMC - Left), makes the painting wobble if touched.
Bowser Left trapdoor, has no action defined.
Misc music like the puzzle jingle.
Add this flag to a [enum SeqId] value to get the variation of the audio sequence (if aplicable).

Number of bits to shift a value before adding it to a [enum SoundBits] value in order to modify the Sound ID. [b]Example:[/b] [codeblocks] [gdscript] # Play the sound that Mario produces when he jumps on snow var jump_on_snow_sound_bits = LibSM64.SOUND_ACTION_TERRAIN_JUMP + ( LibSM64.SOUND_TERRAIN_SNOW << LibSM64.SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID) LibSM64.play_sound_global(jump_on_snow_sound_bits) [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

Terrain-dependent moving sound. A value from [code]0[/code] to [code]7[/code] (see [enum SoundTerrain] for value description) can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]).

Terrain-dependent moving sound. A value from [code]0[/code] to [code]7[/code] (see [enum SoundTerrain] for value description) can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]).

Terrain-dependent moving sound. A value from [code]0[/code] to [code]7[/code] (see [enum SoundTerrain] for value description) can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]).

Terrain-dependent moving sound. A value from [code]0[/code] to [code]7[/code] (see [enum SoundTerrain] for value description) can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]).

Terrain-dependent moving sound. A value from [code]0[/code] to [code]7[/code] (see [enum SoundTerrain] for value description) can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]).

Terrain-dependent moving sound. A value from [code]0[/code] to [code]7[/code] (see [enum SoundTerrain] for value description) can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]).

Terrain-dependent moving sound. A value from [code]0[/code] to [code]7[/code] (see [enum SoundTerrain] for value description) can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]).

Terrain-dependent moving sound. A value from [code]0[/code] to [code]7[/code] (see [enum SoundTerrain] for value description) can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]).

Terrain-dependent moving sound. A value from [code]0[/code] to [code]7[/code] (see [enum SoundTerrain] for value description) can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]).
A number from [code]0[/code] to [code]2[/code] can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing, producing Yah/Wah/Hoo (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]).
A number from [code]0[/code] to [code]2[/code] can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]).

A number from [code]0[/code] to [code]4[/code] can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing, producing one of "Yahoo!" (values [code]0[/code] to [code]2[/code]), "Waha!" (value of [code]3[/code]), or "Yippee!" (value of [code]4[/code]) (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]).

A number from [code]0[/code] to [code]7[/code] can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing, producing the same sound with different pitch (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]). [b]Example:[/b] [codeblocks] [gdscript] func play_red_coin_collected(red_coins_collected: int) -> void: assert(red_coins_collected >= 1 && red_coins_collected <= 8) var collect_red_coin_sound_bits = LibSM64.SOUND_MENU_COLLECT_RED_COIN + ( (red_coins_collected - 1) << LibSM64.SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID) LibSM64.play_sound_global(collect_red_coin_sound_bits) [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

A number from [code]0[/code] to [code]4[/code] can be added to the Sound ID bits before playing, producing the same sound with different pitch (see [constant SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID]). [b]Example:[/b] [codeblocks] [gdscript] func play_secret_collected(secrets_collected: int) -> void: assert(secrets_collected >= 1 && secrets_collected <= 5) var collect_secret_sound_bits = LibSM64.SOUND_MENU_COLLECT_SECRET + ( (secrets_collected - 1) << LibSM64.SOUNDARGS_SHIFT_SOUNDID) LibSM64.play_sound_global(collect_secret_sound_bits) [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]
